availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Appointments by the Governor, Military Appointments, 1862-1863

body.p:
EXECUTIVE DEPARTMENT,
Frankfort, Ky., 7 Jany, 1862.
Dear Sir:

To all to whom it may Concern it is hereby made known that I have this day nominated and appointed and hereby do nominate & appoint Doct Joel S. Price Doct John Walker and John J. Quinn a Sanitary Committe to visit the Soldiers of Kentucky in the Army of the U. S. and to aid & assist in the care cure & comfort of these sick & wounded
As such I command said Committee and each of them as gentlemen loyal to the Government -- worthy of all Confidence and all aid & faculty in the power of all go^od^ men to extend to them
Given under my hand as Governor of Kenty & the seal of The Comth
